Code of Conduct

You must obey this repository’s code of conduct, as must everyone who responds to you on the issue tracker.

Before posting

The GitHub issue tracker is a great place for general usage questions. However, you may alternatively wish to post to Stack Overflow and use the drake-r-package tag.

If you do use the issue tracker, please search the known issues first, both open and closed, including the frequently-asked questions. You may also find the answer to your question in the online manual.

When you post, please include a minimal reproducible example of the problem and/or desired behavior, if applicable. The reprex package package is particularly nice for this.

Also, good style really helps others read the code you share. The tidyverse style guide has suggestions, the styler package is a great way to clean up your code automatically, and the lintr package checks for style issues.

drake is a part of . Learn more at ropensci.org.
